medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to the clinic visit, characterized by subjective fever, fatigue, headache, nasal and sinus congestion, sore throat, and a non-productive cough. Symptoms were less severe compared to a previous pneumonia episode.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 1 diabetes mellitus for 17 years, poorly controlled blood glucose levels, episode of prolonged altered consciousness due to low blood sugar, transient expressive aphasia treated with valproic acid, hypertension, exercise-induced angina, hyperlipidemia, hyperbilirubinemia, glaucoma, and dermatitis herpetiformis treated with dapsone for over 8 years.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at 52 from metastatic colon cancer, both parents had hypertension, mother and sister had migraines, uncle had type 1 diabetes; no other family history of autoimmune diseases.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with wife who had respiratory symptoms a week prior. Drinks alcohol moderately, has never smoked, no illicit drug use.
